results.title: The Fly
results.creator_credit: Kurt Neumann and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This is the classic horror tale of science gone wrong. Vincent Price plays the brother of a brilliant scientist (Al Hedison), who discovers how to transport matter through space. Hedison’s atoms intermingle with those of a common housefly, leaving him with the insect’s head on his body and vice versa. A gruesome freak of nature, he battles to return to normality, however the process slowly drains him of human will. This 1950’s thriller, scripted by acclaimed author James Clavell is capped by a climax which is simultaneously eerie and touching.

results.title: The Fly
results.brief_description: David Cronenberg’s remake of the 1958 horror classic is not for the squeamish. Jeff Goldblum brings a quirky, common touch to the role of Seth Brundle, a brilliant scientist who develops a system to transport objects in a matter of seconds. Things go horribly wrong when Seth tries to transport himself and his genes become accidentally fused with those of a fly. His personality and physical abilities change dramatically and his life becomes a living nightmare as the insect half starts to take over. This masterful thriller with amazing special effects, won an Academy Award for Best Makeup. A nightmarish journey not easily forgotten.

results.title: The Flute
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “We Make Music”.
Richard Adeney, British flautist, discusses the development of the flute over ten centuries showing how the number of holes in the body of the instrument gradually increased and how the use of keys led to the complete chromatic scale. Illustrated by excerpts from Schubert, Mozart, Bizet, Tchaikovsky and Gluck.

results.title: The Fluoridation story
results.brief_description: A short film trailer showing that communities can reduce tooth decay by adding sodium fluoride to their water supply. Emphasises the economy and simplicity of doing so.

results.title: The Flowering city of London
results.creator_credit: Peter Bradford and World Wide Pictures
results.brief_description: The film traces the history of open spaces in the City of London from the Middle Ages to the present day, when gardens and open spaces are slowly being won back for the community. Shows the work of the Corporation of London and the Metropolitan Public Gardens Association. Written by John and Mary Daniels.

results.title: The Flower of my secret = La Flor de mi secreto
results.creator_credit: Pedro Almodovar and Globe Film Co
results.brief_description: Another fine contribution from renowned Spanish director Pedro Almodovar, who returns to the comedy of his earlier works in this humorous yet moving film about a woman in the throes of a creative and emotional crisis. Years of writing bestselling romantic fiction under the pseudonym Amanda Gris have started to take their toll on Leo (Marisa Paredes), who yearns to express herself through a blacker style of writing. Bound by her contract, and immersed in denial over the disintegration of her marriage to Paco (Imanol Arias), she spirals dangerously toward a total breakdown. Her only salvation appears in the form of Angel (Juan Echanove), who offers her a job as a critic for a national arts supplement. Leo’s first assignment - to write a critique of her alter ego, Amanda Gris - sets in motion a chain of events which force her to face reality, and sever ties with the fears of the past. In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: The Flower and the hive
results.creator_credit: J.V. Durden, Larry Gosnell, Peter Jones and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A film showing the relationship between the activity of honey bees and the fertility of field and orchard crops. The process of cross-pollination of flowers by bees is observed in close-up. The life of the hive is similarly illustrated, including the curious dance by which a bee communicates the discovery of a new source of nectar to the colony in the hive .
results.creator_credit_for_label: J.V. Durden, Larry Gosnell, Peter Jones and ONF | NFB

results.title: The Flower
results.creator_credit: Don Haldane, Canadian Cancer Society and Westminster Films
results.brief_description: Tells of the historic discovery in 1959 of a drug called VLB (Vincaleukoblastine), which is still one of the most effective means of fighting Hodgkin’s disease, or cancer of the lymph glands.

results.title: The Flow of electricity
results.brief_description: Explains the factors which affect the flow of electricity through a simple electrical circuit, introduces the electron theory, and shows the application of a simple circuit in a home situation. The film is centred around the inquiries of two children whose father explains to them what electricity is, how it flows through a closed circuit, what the function of the switch is, and how electricity used in the home travels over an electrical circuit.
